reviews.review_msg: I forced myself to go to every lecture because I had hoped it would be helpful in the end, but really I regretted going every time.  Lectures are repetitive and not very helpful.  If you have a good TA, go to your tutorials, and read all the books, you'll be fine.  However, I would not take this class again.

Very average. Nothing horrible, but then nothing stellar either. Had some neat insights into the material, but come exam time all that really mattered was your own take on it, making the lectures pretty much pointless.

David is a very knowledgable, caring professor. He is always there for extra help and his exams are straightforward. Hard marker of essays, but all in all very interesting texts. He seems to REALLY care about his students and listen to their opinions.
Made the lectures actually interesting. Really tried to get the class to participate. Assignments and exams were fair. Books were quite boring, but his teaching made up for it.

Every year, my English teachers get better and better.  This year was no different.  David is by far, the best English teacher you will ever encounter with.  Plus, u can easily mistake him for a student.  Wears nice clothes, carries backpack, always smiling
Chariandy rules!!!!  He is hot and cool and smart, great way to start off the SFU experience.
He's got a great aura. = )! Very nice. Very approachable...

Lectures are obvious and somewhat uninteresting. Teaches like everyone just hatched out of highschool, i guess for those who did it might be of some value. T.A. was horrible and can only blame Chariandy. Chariandy was enthusiastic and very helpful of what the class requires however.

Wonderful person outside of the lecture theatre. Unfortunately, lectures are dry and irrelevant to the novels, assignments, and exam. She would bring up historic examples which were confusing and unnecessary, even the TA admitted that he was confused by her explanations from time to time! She does explain herself better in office hours though.

Susan is honestly one of my favourite profs at SFU, she genuinely cares about her students & is always willing to go the extra mile to help them. She chose four books, and you are given 2 weeks to read each one, and then two short stories. You also have to maintain a reading journal for each book. Despite the amount of work, this is class is great!

Super charismatic and well spoken, boring powerpoints though. Keep up with readings and writing journals and you'll do fine. The books she chose for my semester (Violence - Fight Club, Persepolis, Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close, Disgrace) were awesome! Within the last decade and all had movies (but try to read the books, they're different)

To be honest, Susan is one of my favourite profs at SFU. She's a great teacher, super into what she's teaching, and makes everything as interesting as possible. the way she talks about each of the novels gets you really engaged in the course. I definitely recommend taking English 101 with her.
Love her accent so much. So nice to listen too and brings forth great ideas about the novels

Her lectures were interesting, but to be honest they weren't necessary unless you really didn't understand the assigned readings. Tutorials were mandatory and definitely helpful. Overall the class was interesting and pretty easy.

I had low expectations for a fiction course focusing on short stories but she chose ones that were interesting (and somewhat disturbing at times.) Engaging in lectures, she is not only articulate and intelligent but also funny as hell, well worth getting up at 8:30 for.

notes are too brief and so u need to rely on ur ears..and never upload them on the internet so U HAV TO GO TO CLASS. she tries to make the class interesting by showing clips from youtube. i didnt really learn much from her class and often quite repetitive(fiction helps us view the world blahblah) but she's pretty nice =)

I enjoyed the course a lot. The required readings were long but interesting, but avoid this course if you hate reading. Nadine is passionate about the course material and very caring to her students. Her grading is a bit tough but if you participate a lot and go to her office hours you'll be OK. Sit in front- her voice is rather quiet.
Final exam is not clear, do not take this class. TAs are awesome though.

WAY TOO hard of a marker for English 101, she expects your writing to be perfect otherwise you get a C. And she'll put lots of checkmarks on your papers so you think you are doing well then she smacks a big 64% on the paper and you are left more confused than ever.

She definitely engages the students into the course by sharing her enthusiasm. Very helpful and open-minded. She has given me a much better experience in English. I know that some students have commented on how she seems to stick to her own answers but in English, as long as an answer is well supported, the prof usually accepts it (as with my case)

Intro to Poetry with Everton is a good class, esp if you enjoy poetry. I thought it was a great class! He structures the class well so those people who dont get poetry can still understand something. As well he is very welcoming of outside comments. I recommend going to the office hours if you're confused.

I totally agree with what people said above!! One of my friends got lower scores than me in all the categories. However, he got higher overall grade. His grading systems completely totally entirely sucks. You will be regretful to choose his course.
I didnt like her at all
All she does it read off her power points. Her class was not useful to me at all. She was a nice teacher, but I did not learn a thing in her class.

All she really does is read off her ppts, I think she is a nice teacher, but sometimes I do not find attending her class useful. During her exams it's YOUR analysis, so what she writes on her ppts is very very broad, and not always the most helpful. Books were not that great either unfortunately.

quite posibly the best teacher I will ever have, she totaly goes above and beyond to help students write better and think about lit in a new way....her office hours are always full with other students but then again, can you say that about any of your other profs?

I'm sucked at writing, but she is a nice prof. She makes the grading policy very tough and if you get a tougher TA, things would never go into the right directions. I didn't see any improvements in my writing skills, but her class made me love reading fictions. Overall she is neither a great nor a bad prof.
She's passionate with the materials and the subject she teaches. Quite easy to handle.

Don't pass the chance of being in her class because Professor P.D. is an excellent teacher! Very helpful and always willing to assist her students in their work. Professional, and comes to class very well prepared. Students can learn alot from attending her classes, that's for sure.

OMG. PAUL IS THE BEST! He is absolutely intelligent and articulate. He is also very sweet, caring and kind-hearted. He cares about students as actual people rather than numbers in a class. Most of the stories and books that he chose were very interesting and enlightening. I highly recommend his classes. SFU should be proud of having Paul SERIOUSLY!
Easy class.. weird stories... easy marking.. easy course load what more do u want?

Yeesh--this guy freaked me out! Talks way too much about downright weird and irrelevant stuff. I mean, I REALLY didn't need to know about his sexual exploits all over Europe. Lectures didn't help me much.

Very good teacher, often can grasp things that you would never have thought of. Truly cares about helping students, (any teacher that allows you to call him at home does). For ENGL101 final, he pretty much gave us the whole exam before we had to write it.
I did not like him at all. His lectures made no sense and he spent have the time talking about his personal life and his publications. Very weird sense of humour.
No Comments
awesome prof, esp on halloween hehe last semester
Inspirational, spiritual, fair, respectful and remarkable!

Didn't get anything out of lecture but her ruining the ending before it was due to be read.  I got more out of the TA than I did out of her and thought he should have taught the class.  (Attendance would have been better)

easy papers, as she and the TAs are extremely helpful. michelle gives very detailed outlines on how to write the papers,and the TA's are very generous. the final exam was a breeze, she basically told us what was going to be on the exam, outlined the terms we needed to know and everything. great prof! definitely recommended.

I would take any of Steve's classes again if I could. He's an amazing instructor - very engaging and likes to get to know his students. He's really knowledgable and understanding so take the opportunity to discuss anything with him, you won't be disappointed. Pay attention to his lectures, read the books and it's easy A.
Love Steven! Best teacher ever. His classes are super fun enjoy it alot. Do you work, read your books and yoh will pass.
Good sense of humour!
A total sweetheart with a great sense of humour.
Fell asleep in class cuz the lecture room was too warm. The topics that were discussed in class helps you think about the novels and prep for essay/final. Fair marking. Recommend this prof.
Her classes are hard, but really interesting and made me love English!
quite a nice lady and very helpful in class and over email. hard to get an A but equally hard to do badly if you know anything about the english language/writing and attend lecture/tutorial.

Interesting books, very enlightening,entertaining lectures. I learned so much in this class and I enjoyed every bit of it. It was a pretty easy class but you need to do work (obviously, like in every other class you take).

I think this is probbaly the first english course I took where you actually had to read all the books in order to feel comfortable doing the final. The course itself is pretty easy, though if you absolutely suck at English then you need to work hard. Not too hard to bust your brain, but hard enough that you don't slack off.
We read some really great books. She made things very clear and was a decent lecturer, but got kind of tedious after a while. Lots of writing, but it was all pretty easy.

Interesting class! She's always prepared, incorporates other media into the classroom (movies and interviews), plays good music before lectures. But I think she goes a little too far with some of her interpretations. But great overall =)

I'm currently in English 101 right now, I must tell you, I'm very impressed with Colligan. She definitely knows how to engage the class and demands for attention. I actually met with her once and she's just a lovely lady with great kindness and great interest in the books she used to study in class. Overall, Colligan is just great!!
Dr. Colligan is frighteningly intelligent and looks like Kate Moss.  I have never learned so much in my life, nor been so awed by brilliance.

I would encourage and suggest this course to everyone!!! Her lectures are not boring at all and she makes it interesting by bringing movies as a reference to whatever she's teaching.  Her choice of fictions are better than other professors that teach this course.  I am attracted to her intelligence.
English wasn't my strongest class, no idea why I took it, but the course was great. I enjoyed the lectures and novels and learned a lot. I think she's an excellent prof.

You can tell Colette is very prepared for her lectures. Despite her annoying usage of "um", her lectures are so interesting because she provides so many different types of media to complement the books. Essay topics for take-homes, inclass, and final are fair. GO TO LECTURES. GET A GOOD TA!
She's an awesome teacher! Taught me how to close read. I never knew that a passage could be so subjective and stem from it so many interpretations.

Enjoyable course. It was nice to take a philosophical approach to literature instead of sitting through hours of close readings. Colette wasn't brilliant but she put an outstanding amount of effort into preparation and implementing additional materials. Has a wonderful way with words too. Two thumbs up.
interesting lectures, always easy to stay awake for, sound and movie clips were good.
A really fun class, lectures were rarely dull and the tests were very fair. Quite an enjoyable class.

Colette is one awesome professor.  It is a class that I always enjoy going to and she is extremely prepared to teach.  I enjoy hearing all of her ideas and the books we read were enjoyable.  I think most students share this point of view with the lecture usually quite full in comparison to some of my other classes.  The tutorials are also very fun.

This class is not helpful if you are hoping to learn about anything to do with ENGLISH, this is an ABORIGINAL STUDIES course. I have not learned a single thing to do with English, She is a nice person who I respect greatly as a Prof, but I would not advise this course to anyone unless you are looking for an Aboriginal studies course.

Deanna is a wonderful professor. This is an ENGLISH course. People are simply reacting to the fact that the ENGLISH literature that we covered had first nations topics. The themes of the novels were first Nations themes, in any english course the professor takes a direction. If people were upset over it they should have dropped the course.

Lectures were very boring and dull but they are a must to attend because her lecture notes she posts online are useless (for example, she posts a picture on the notes but in lecture will talk on and on about it). Lectures are  useful for the short stories. Did not enjoy this as it was more first nations 101 than english 101.

Deanna Reder is very helpful, i've asked her several questions and her responses were really helpful. And all of the people who are complaining, why does it matter if you're learning about natives? It's an english class, doesnt matter what you read or learn it's about improving your writing skills.
Karen was a great prof. She has really interesting lectures and she was a great speaker. She seemed fairly easy at marking, and was really helpful in tutorials when you asked her for help.

He is very disrespectful to his students. I went and asked a few questions related to his lecture and he wouldn't give me an answer and just tell me that he mentioned it during the lecture. I heard a few other students had been in the same situation as me. I wish I visited this website earlier and didn't take his course.

Was more on religion than on fiction. Ogden was very polemic with his own views. His exam was unfair, as he tested on things he specifically said he would NOT test on. He was also dismissive to one student who actually seemed enthusiastic about the subject matter. The only thing I really enjoyed was the reading list (I love comics and superheroes).

His lectures were disorganized, and clearly recycled from previous years (often he forgot to delete the heading "English 383"). He displayed bias,was passive aggressive and bullied students. The final exam didn't test the main ideas of the course, partial marks weren't allowed for 5 mark questions, and it mainly tested his opinions.

with most of the class clueless like me, it was a needless GPA killer for a "W" course.  too many abstract ideas and the final exam was hard.  oh yeah, and my TA was terrible too...marked harder than other TAs
Worst English teacher ever. Desultory lectures, antagonistic behavior, give me a break.

How can I sum up English 101 with Stephen Ogden? WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY! Nobody has a clue what they're writing down in lecture, they just keep doing it and hoping that it'll make sense before the final! Boring and confusing!

HORRIBLE! This guy is not only useless and confusing but also incredibly annoying! He's the rudest prof I've ever had, people would walk into lecture late and he would spend five minutes on each on complaining about them being late! The class has 500 people in it, nobody notices a late person until he starts talking about it and disrupting the clas
I don't think I learned anything useful at all from this class. The lectures were impossible to follow and all-in-all, pointless.
He overinterprets EVERYTHING! He could could connect a waterbottle to one of the books! Just make sure you understand all of the random things he says in lecture and you`ll be fine.
Such a great and funny prof.  Very intelligent and Helpful.  I would recommend taking one of his classes.

Carolyn is great!! Loved the course, and she makes it fun by showing us goofy music videos and joking around once and a while. Expectations were clear and marking was fair. Really knows her stuff. Would definitely recommend!

super nice prof, very clear about what he wants from your essays. Interesting lectures, I took a night class with him and dont feel sleepy at all. A very inspiring prof. He just makes you fall in love with English

Best prof I've had. Great guy and an even better teacher.  He is willing to spend time and make you improve on whatever that you may need to improve on. Work hard and you are guaranteed to do well in this class.
Great prof! Best prof I've had in three years.

Although she is a nice person, I found that she did not really give enought instruction for assignments. She is also VERY picky about grammar/bibliographies, and will dock tons of marks for tiny mistakes. However, she is a really nice person.
Don't expect this to be a walk in the park. Sophie is really helpful and clear in what she wants for papers, but this isn't high school English anymore.
One of the best professors I've encountered yet.  Definitely take this course if he teaches!
really good prof!  I enjoyed the books too.
fantastic lectures!
Good prof but don't like some of the TA's
Very friendly and handsome. Nice and attractive guy.Good at poems.
Friendly, helpful, lectures a little boring (too much bg info on books/authors)
Scott Marsden is the best teacher ever, plus he is HOT! So good looking its hard to focus on the work when he is teaching.
Best at teaching english literature. Probably the least tough grader i ever met in sfu.
